intro: Centranthus battandieri, commonly known as the Balkan redflower. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula, characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular red or pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
